properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 8:57AM PST until February 8 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING IMPACTFUL SNOW TO AREA MOUNTAINS TONIGHT
THROUGH SATURDAY...

.A storm system will approach the area from the northwest this
evening. A colder airmass will lower snow levels significantly
before a plume of moisture creates impactful snow for the
Washington Cascades and Blue Mountains of Oregon and Washington
overnight through Saturday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12
inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds may
create blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities may be briefly
impaired.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel, be
prepared with warm clothes, food, water, and a flashlight.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting tripcheck.org (Oregon)
or wsdot.wa.gov (Washington).

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY
